headline: Robert Kiyosaki Says US Heading for 'Greater Depression' But You Can Become 'Very Rich Person' In This Crisis If You Do This
summary: The number of famous Wall Street analysts and economic experts warning about recession has surged dramatically in recent weeks. Much of this concern stems from weakening consumer sentiment and a slowing economy. The US GDP fell 0.3% year over year in the March quarter, marking the first quarterly decline since 2022. Robert Kiyosaki, investor and author of the best-selling book "Rich Dad Poor Dad," said last month that the US may be heading toward a "greater depression" as the economy continues t

headline: Nvidia earnings, Fed Chair Powell, April PCE: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime anchors Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton preview the biggest news stories and market headlines expected out next week, including earnings results from semiconductor giant Nvidia (NVDA), HP Inc. (HPQ), Salesforce (CRM), and retailers Kohl's (KSS), Costco (COST), and Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS); commentary from Federal Reserve Jerome Powell on Sunday; and April's Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index coming out next Friday. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Taking Stock of the Earnings Picture
summary: The earnings release from Nvidia is the true highlight of this week's earnings docket, though there are a few other bellwethers on deck to report results as well. Nearing its end, how has the Q1 cycle fared so far?

headline: 'Nobody Is Holding A Gun To My Head' Says 89-Year-Old Costco Co-Founder Who Still Goes To Work Because He Loves It
summary: Costco co-founder Jim Sinegal still visits the company's Issaquah, Washington, headquarters every Tuesday just because he enjoys it. “Nobody is holding a gun to my head,” Sinegal said during a 2016 speech at Loyola Marymount University, highlighting his voluntary commitment to the company he helped build. Sinegal may have stepped down as CEO in 2012, but he’s far from done. And he's not alone. A growing number of older Americans are rethinking retirement, blending passion with purpose well past

headline: 1 Unpopular Stock that Deserves a Second Chance and 2 to Be Wary Of
summary: When Wall Street turns bearish on a stock, it’s worth paying attention. These calls stand out because analysts rarely issue grim ratings on companies for fear their firms will lose out in other business lines such as M&A advisory.
